args:
The party meets a young woman named Lin You
who is on a journey to train as a warrior.
Taking a hint from some folklore she shares,
they quickly realize the town could be attacked
by fiends, so they put the dragon-vein spring
investigation on hold and head back to Peng Lai.
Whew! There are quite a number\nof fiends in this area, it seems.
That's troubling; we aren't\nall that far from the town.
Is it always like this around here,\nSu Fang?
No. There are many fiends within the\nforest, but they shouldn't be here.
Mao! Mao Mao!\n(Taste my fists of fury, vile fiends!)
Mao Mao! MAO!\n(Shattering Mao Mao Punch!)
M-mao!\n(M-my attack didn't defeat you?!\nWowsers, you sure are something!)
Get outta the way, Mao Mao!
Mao MAO!\n(I'm not in the way! I'm HELPING!)
Just let me handle this already!
Fiends are attacking that girl!\nAnd, er...that panda?
Stand back! We'll take care of this!
Whew! That should do it for the fiends.\nAre you all right?
YOU JERK! You took out ALL the fiends!
I was just about to do that!
Mao Mao!\n(We were going to prove our strength!)
Although YOU beat the fiends...\nWhich means if WE beat YOU,\nwe're stronger than the fiends!
I am very confused right now.
Come on! We have to duel!
I don't WANT to duel you!
Huh? But my master said people would\nspar with me if I asked nicely.
We could at least do with proper\nintroductions first, don't you think?
Ack! You're right! Er, sorry about that.\nI got carried away when I thought I'd be\nable to throw down with strong warriors.
My name is Lin You, and I've come all\nthe way from Taiwu on a journey to\ntrain myself into a true warrior.
And this here is Mao Mao. He might look\nlike a panda, but he's actually a dragon.\n...Still just a kid, though.
You're from Taiwu? That explains why\nyou have a similar spirit to the people\nof Peng Lai.
Wait, are you saying there's a whole\nTOWN of Taiwu people around here?
Well, not Taiwu people exactly, but our\nancestors came from there.
About a hundred years ago, people of\nthe Qilin tribe came here from Taiwu\nand founded this town.

If I'm not mistaken, they were a small tribe
that resided in a secluded place. Legends
say they possessed mysterious skills and
techniques in many subjects.

Indeed. For example, the manufacturing
process for pyroblossoms was brought
here by Xu Fuâ€”a member of the Qilin
tribe and the founder of our town.
Actually, my masterâ€”the one who's\nteaching me to be a warriorâ€”is a\nmember of the Qilin tribe.
You're being taught martial arts by one\nof the Qilin tribe?! Thatâ€™s incredible!
Hee hee! My master actually ordered\nme on this journey in order to train.\nSo what are you all doing here?
We've come from Peng Lai to investigate\nthe dragon-vein spring that dried up.
It's understandable that youâ€™re shocked.\nUnder normal circumstances, such things\nshould be impossible.
Actually, now that I think about it,\nmy master mentioned something like\nthat happening a long time ago.
Oh man, it was sooo long ago.\nI don't really...
Can't you remember anything at all?\nIt could contain a vital clue!

Well I thiiink it was because the people
kept sucking up the land's energy or
something? Oh, and even the fiends
had their mana pulled from them.
Lost mana... Fiends...\nMore fiends than usual...\nOh!
We must get back to Peng Lai right now!
If my calculations are correct, the town\nis about to be attacked by fiends!
We're not the only ones who have been\nblessed by the dragon-vein spring's mana.\nThe fiends have also benefited.
When fiends that once obtained mana\nfrom a spring can no longer do so,\nthey will seek out a substitute.
And mana gathers in places where there\nis life. Forests, lakes...and towns.
There isn't a more abundant mana source\naround here than the town of Peng Lai.
They're going to be in real trouble!
Then we'll investigate the spring later.\nLet's get back to town right now!
